entry.name: accordion
entry.desc: Convert a pair of headers and content panels into an accordion.

longdesc.p: Make the selected elements Accordion widgets.
The markup of your accordion container needs pairs of headers and content panels:
longdesc.pre:
First header

First content panel

Second header

Second content panel
longdesc.p: Accordions support arbitrary markup, but each content panel must always be the next sibling after its associated header. See the header option for information on how to use custom markup structures.
The panels can be activated programmatically by setting the active option..
This widget requires some functional CSS, otherwise it won't work. If you build a custom theme, use the widget's specific CSS file as a starting point.

option.name: active
option.desc:
The zero-based index of the panel that is active (open). A negative value select panels going backward from the last panel.
When the collapsible option is set to true, a value of false closes the accordion; otherwise nothing happens.

option.name: animate
option.desc:
If and how to animate changing panels:
String: Name of easing to use with default duration.
Number: Duration in milliseconds with default easing.
Object: Animation settings with easing and duration properties.
Can also contain a down property with any of the above options.
"Down" animations occur when the panel being activated has a lower index than the currently active panel.
null/false: Disables animation.

option.name: collapsible
option.desc: Whether all the sections can be closed at once. Allows collapsing the active section.

option.name: event
option.desc: The event that accordion headers will react to in order to activate the associated panel. Multiple events can be specificed, separated by a space.

option.name: header
option.desc:
Selector for the header element.
Must be a selector that applies to the accordion container element, via .find().
The default covers both ul/li accordions, as well as flat structures like dl/dt/dd.

option.name: heightStyle
option.desc:
Controls the height of the accordion and each panel. Possible values:
"auto": All panels will be set to the height of the tallest panel.
"fill": Expand to the available height based on the accordion's parent height.
"content": each panel will be only as tall as its content.

option.name: icons
option.desc:
Icons to use for headers, matching an icon defined by the jQuery UI CSS Framework. Set to false to have no icons displayed.
header (string, default: "ui-icon-triangle-1-e")
activeHeader (string, default: "ui-icon-triangle-1-s")

event.name: activate
event.desc: Triggered after a panel has been activated (after animation completes).

event.name: beforeActivate
event.desc: Triggered directly after a panel is activated. Can be cancelled to prevent the panel from activating.

event.name: create
event.desc: Triggered when the accordion is created.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Recompute the height of the accordion panels. Results depend on the content and the heightStyle option.
